creditline: The Kelly and Geoffrey Gage Endowment for Art Acquisition
description: image of a stuffed tan toy horse with white mane and tail and a black harness on a tan couch with orange flowers
portfolio: From the series The Ache for Home (2011-2015)
signed: verso LRC in pencil: Selma Fernández Richter / Horse, Saint Paul, MN, 2012
text: Fernández Richter worked in close collaboration with a number of immigrant communities within the Twin Cities in the course of grappling with her own move from Mexico to the United States. Her photographs within the homes of Karen refugees from Myanmar are not merely documentary; instead, they capture the complexity of their position—socially and politically—in contemporary America. Notable for her masterful compositions of everyday life, Fernández Richter has a strong capacity for finding the emotional heft in small details— the fading floral pattern on a sofa, the soft cheek of a child pressed against a plastic fire truck—to make the lives of her immigrant subjects accessible.
title: Horse, Saint Paul, MN
